required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adverse Event Data Collection From External Registries on Nonacog Beta Pegol
clinical_study.official_title: Adverse Event Data Collection From External Registries on Nonacog Beta Pegol

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect data on adverse events from third party registries that include information about adverse events from patients with haemophilia B treated with nonacog beta pegol. The third party registries include PedNet Haemophilia Registry (PedNet) and the European Haemophilia Safety Surveillance System (EUHASS). Data from national and international registries in countries where nonacog beta pegol has been approved and marketed could be included in the data collection.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs) reported to the registries with suspected relation to nonacog beta pegol in patients with haemophilia B
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of data collection (week 0) to end of data collection (after 9 years)
primary_outcome.description: Number of events (renal, hepatic, neurodevelopmental, neurocognitive, neurologic or psychiatric events)

secondary_outcome.measure: Other ADRs reported to the registries during the study period with suspected relation to nonacog beta pegol in patients with haemophilia B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of data collection (week 0) to end of data collection (after 9 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of events (de novo FIX inhibitors more than or equal to 0.6 Bethesda units); anaphylaxis and other allergic reactions; thromboembolic events)

arm_group.description: Patients with haemophilia B treated with nonacog beta pegol who report adverse events to the PedNet and EUHASS, and possibly other national or international registries.

intervention.description: Treatment with commercially available nonacog beta pegol according to routine clinical practice at the discretion of the treating physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participation in the PedNet Registry and/or the European Haemophilia Safety Surveillance System (EUHASS), or other national and international registries
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not applicable as this is a study collecting third-party data from registries

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
